posts.post_content: @raverboy1123 - Look again, the [Reiver Demon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Reiver Demon) doesn't deal damage to anyone or anything when it comes into play, rather it destroys, and since it doesn't specifically target, creatures like [Akroma, Angel of Wrath](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Akroma, Angel of Wrath) WOULD perish to it. If it didn't as you have stated, then other creatures like [Progenitus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Progenitus) wouldn't die from a [Wrath of God](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wrath of God), even though Wizards has clearly stated that it can due to the effect that [Wrath of God](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wrath of God) gives to the entire battlefield. Much like the [Reiver Demon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Reiver Demon)'s ability.

posts.post_content:
The art for this is perfect, and I'll tell you why.  
It depicts Akroma at her very essence.  
Chippy's captured a perfect balance of flawless beauty and inhuman monster.  
  
[Ixidor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=40578) modeled her after his dead lover, so she's got a bit of Mary Sue-level of beauty going on. Pretty face, great curves, midnight black hair, shamelessly stripperiffic outfit.  
She's also a soulless killing machine. Which is also pulled off very well. The liquid paper white skin. Cold emotionless face. Dead, empty eyes.
posts.html:
The art for this is perfect, and I'll tell you why.
It depicts Akroma at her very essence.
Chippy's captured a perfect balance of flawless beauty and inhuman monster.

Ixidor modeled her after his dead lover, so she's got a bit of Mary Sue-level of beauty going on. Pretty face, great curves, midnight black hair, shamelessly stripperiffic outfit.

Posted By: HairlessThoctar (7/12/2010 4:36:00 PM)
Rating:

@raverboy112 - SolidSoldier and subsequently Jedijoe are both right.

Pro something means it cannot be targeted by spells or abilities of the appropriate protection, blocked (in most cases at least, except such cases when a creature is put into play already blocking, such as one from the new schemes in archenemy.) and all damage dealt to it would be prevented with exception of other rare cases such as me attacking with an Excruciator and you block it with Akroma, it would kill the Akroma even though she has pro red. Mass removal though, does not deal damage, nor does it target, thus getting around protection and killing Akroma, if in fact the Reiver Demon was cast from a player's hand. xD

Yay bandwagons! also, it's spelled geniuses**

Ok, so this seems to be the only card immune to people hating on the reprint art.   
  
But, even if somebody wanted to complain, I finally have an explanation. Check out Linvala, Keeper of Silence, Angelic Arbiter, and Balance. This is a much more 'White' Akroma than the original Legions one. In some ways, Akroma, Angel of Fury was simply putting the old Akroma in the correct card frame.   
  
Akroma is pretty damn badass either way.  
  
EDIT: it has been a long and prestigious career for Akroma, but I suspect that [Avacyn, Archangel of Innistrad](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Avacyn, Archangel of Innistrad) (also known as Sorin Markov's Galatean girlfriend), may finally top Akroma as the most powerful Angel in Magic. Judging by [Vault of the Archangel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vault of the Archangel) we are already looking at Flying, First Strike, Vigilance, Lifelink, Deathtouch, Protection from Vampires, Werewolves, and Zombies. That really seems actually reasonable, unless they make her a Demon-hoser instead/as well? I wonder what the mana cost and power/toughne... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
@Ferlord  
  
Per the Comprehensive Rules, protection is a static ability that permanents have (CR 702.15a). Static abilities are active only while a permanent is on the battlefield (CR 112.3d) and a card ceases to be a permanent if it is not on the battlefield (CR 110.1).  
  
So no. Akroma's protection works only while she's a permanent (i.e. on the battlefield). She is not a permanent if she is in the graveyard, hand, or library; thus, she isn't protected in those zones.  
  
However, [Necromancy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Necromancy) and [Animate Dead](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Animate Dead) bring a creature back onto the battlefield and attach themselves to that creature. When Akroma is brought onto the battlefield, she has protection from black. Akroma's ability will cause these enchantments to be unable to attach themselves to her, and she will be sacrificed. [Zombify](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Zombify), [Buried Alive](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Buried Alive), [Reanimate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Reanimate) or [Surgical Extraction](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Surgical Extraction) will work on her, because they do... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
@Ferlord

Per the Comprehensive Rules, protection is a static ability that permanents have (CR 702.15a). Static abilities are active only while a permanent is on the battlefield (CR 112.3d) and a card ceases to be a permanent if it is not on the battlefield (CR 110.1).

So no. Akroma's protection works only while she's a permanent (i.e. on the battlefield). She is not a permanent if she is in the graveyard, hand, or library; thus, she isn't protected in those zones.

However, Necromancy and Animate Dead bring a creature back onto the battlefield and attach themselves to that creature. When Akroma is brought onto the battlefield, she has protection from black. Akroma's ability will cause these enchantments to be unable to attach themselves to her, and she will be sacrificed. Zombify, Buried Alive, Reanimate or Surgical Extraction will work on her, because they do... (see all)

posts.post_content:
I have a question:   
  
I'm running a resurrection EDH deck which is primarily Black, but I am using [Progenitus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Progenitus) as my general so I can resurrect my best creatures instead of just black ones.   
  
Anyway, would Akroma be untargetable by such effects like [Necromancy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Necromancy), [Animate Dead](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Animate Dead), [Zombify](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Zombify) or even [Buried Alive](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Buried Alive)? These cards do state that you choose target creature, but does the "protection" ability affect Akroma from outside of the battlefield?  
  
I have a (bad) feeling it does, but I just want this answered from the "experts" (that being... well, you guys!). I read the rules, but it didn't exactly say that it has protection from all points of the game. (For example, would Akroma not be able to be targeted by [Surgical Extraction](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Surgical Extraction), since it is already in the graveyard?)  
  
Thanks for your help
posts.html:

I'm running a resurrection EDH deck which is primarily Black, but I am using Progenitus as my general so I can resurrect my best creatures instead of just black ones.

Anyway, would Akroma be untargetable by such effects like Necromancy, Animate Dead, Zombify or even Buried Alive? These cards do state that you choose target creature, but does the "protection" ability affect Akroma from outside of the battlefield?

I have a (bad) feeling it does, but I just want this answered from the "experts" (that being... well, you guys!). I read the rules, but it didn't exactly say that it has protection from all points of the game. (For example, would Akroma not be able to be targeted by Surgical Extraction, since it is already in the graveyard?)

Thanks for your help
